body:
Gradle 4.2.x fails on rat and python:

```
FAILURE: Build completed with 2 failures.

1: Task failed with an exception.
-----------
* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':rat'.
> Found 905 files with unapproved/unknown licenses. See file:/home/jbonofre/Workspace/beam/build/reports/rat/rat-report.txt

* Try:
Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
==============================================================================

2: Task failed with an exception.
-----------
* Where:
Build file '/home/jbonofre/Workspace/beam/sdks/python/build.gradle' line: 64

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':beam-sdks-parent:beam-sdks-python:lint'.
> Process 'command 'tox'' finished with non-zero exit value 1

```

On the other hand, I will take a look for the Gradle 4.3 support.
@aaltay @reuvenlax Is it possible to get this reviewed or change reviewer?
Thank you @chamikaramj and @jkff for the previous review. Here's another iteration of changes.
It looks like the usual failure in `universal_local_runner`. I think it should probably be sickbayed given how many builds it hits.
@jkff try/catch in `TestWriteWithErrors` could be removed and `ExceptedException` put back with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3158

To my knowledge, arbitrary pipeline options don't make it to the runner harness.
Why the swap away from worker metadata configuration, did using a map -> list of kv conversion not work?
The metadata field is a Map. That wouldn't typecheck.

You mean hacking it with a custom jackson hook? I'd rather not mess with that, since pipelineoptions is already a pretty arbitrary bag and actually sort of better than VM metadata for this kind of data.

All builds passed:
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Go_MavenInstall/631/
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/15565/
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Python_MavenInstall/717/

Following changes are only going to be for Gradle build files so we know that the current set of changes don't break the Maven based build.

OK. The only changes I could imagine messing with maven would be the move from `${property}` to `@property@`. I think we should have some more discussion and review but I'm pretty excited to try it out. Once it is in we can try setting up some additional presubmits that use it, hopefully seeing how much the caching can help for modules that are not touched.
cc @aaltay any idea why this would fail here (or how to get the log file out of jenkins)? It hasn't even it the point of changes when it fails to generate.
Arbitrary pipeline options still don't make it to the runner harness.
@herohde can you comment on this? I think that we have adequate control to get this info to the right place noninvasively.
Pipeline options are available to the runner harness in Dataflow, so this approach would work fine. It's trivial to make the runner harness grab what it needs here.
We have some basic unit tests for the property rules in: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/util/ReleaseInfoTest.java

Dataflow validates runner tests also passed:
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/4310/
OK, seems that the changes are not done yet. Please ping this thread when ready for another round.
LGTM. Have you tested running this?

I'll update this today and tomorrow

On Wed, Nov 8, 2017, 02:19 Etienne Chauchot <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> ping?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADQu6cjoBvLxDMjeGBs9cJHu5suimedLks5s0YAvgaJpZM4Ps1EC>
> .
>
leave the desactivation of the thread leaks checker because there is other unrelated thread leaks (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3119)
@jkff I addressed all your comments PTAL
I have also checked by cherrypicking that mobile game user score example works well with this change on the release branch.

CC: @robertwb 
It doesn't seem as though the Python SDK currently exposes the on time behavior in any meaningful way so it seems like we should always be using ALWAYS_FIRE. Note that this was the default before BEAM-2961 was fixed anyways.
All commits are cherrypicks from master.

Are the test faiures understood?

On Thu, Nov 9, 2017 at 2:22 PM, tvalentyn <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> All commits are cherrypicks from master.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AUGE1TG7y73zawofkgDxiZBFeRnFTuklks5s03sTgaJpZM4QYvMn>
> .

Looks like you are using the same issue id: `BEAM-3147` for two PRs, it might be better to split this `BEAM-3147` issue into several smaller issue to better tracking things.

Java test suite fails with [ERROR] Could not find the selected project in the reactor: sdks/java/fn-execution. This is caused by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3047. 
The maven project in question was added to master in https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/fdd5971d95df3219954023c6806f09dce87a1f8c but we don't have it in the release branch. 

This PR does not affect Java codebase and is safe to merge.

approved for self-merge then.

On Thu, Nov 9, 2017 at 8:22 PM, tvalentyn <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Java test suite fails with [ERROR] Could not find the selected project in
> the reactor: sdks/java/fn-execution. This is caused by

@echauchot I tried `mvn clean install -DskipTests exec:java -Dexec.mainClass=org.apache.beam.sdk.nexmark.Main -Pdirect-runner -Dexec.args="--runner=DirectRunner --suite=SMOKE --streaming=false --query=1 --manageResources=true --monitorJobs=true --enforceEncodability=true --enforceImmutability=true --sinkType=KAFKA --bootstrapServers=localhost:9092"`

It works for me on my local. I can't reproduce. @iemejia Could you test this on your side?
I am afraid I am not an authorized committer to run @asfgit merge.

Can you please explain the motivation of such a big refactor, From a quick look I have the impression that the rewrite is more of a way to understand the base code than really needed for your intended goal of supporting the SQL. Of course there are some interesting pieces there but not sure if this huge refactor is really needed.

@vectorijk thanks for the fixes! I still have 2 comments:
- what about implementing COMBINED mode?
- a remark for the future: you should rebase your branch on master and not merge master into your branch (see beam contribution guide). Can you remove the merge commits (using rebase -i) and, rebase on master?
Waiting for @iemejia to test on his local setup for the `org.apache.kafka.common.protocol.types.SchemaException: Error reading field 'topic_metadata'`
Fixed cython errors. All tests should pass now. PTAL.
closing and reopening to re-trigger tests
Python tests pass; Java test failures are unrelated.
@aljoscha -- no timeout error in jenkins build this time.
@jkff I addressed most of your comments. Just checking to configuration the plain authentication provider programmatically in order to avoid the `passwd` file.

See thread at https://twitter.com/nedgar/status/929765848750977026
Basically, the min timestamp calculation in `_TransformWatermarks.refresh()` is expensive due to iterating over all elements in the bundle, and is called repeatedly. By adding `get_min_timestamp` to Bundle, it need only iterate over the root elements, e.g. taking timestamp directly from _StackedWindowedValues rather than iterating over their elements.
It also memoizes the min timestamp if the bundle is committed.

Before:
```
$ time python wordcount_minimal.py --input kinglear.txt --output counts
...
real	0m4.726s
user	0m4.457s
sys	0m0.214s

$ time python wordcount_minimal.py --input kinglear_x4.txt --output counts
...
real	0m22.268s
user	0m21.744s
sys	0m0.722s
```

After:
```
$ time python wordcount_minimal.py --input kinglear.txt --output counts
...
real	0m3.893s
user	0m3.623s
sys	0m0.189s

$ time python wordcount_minimal.py --input kinglear_x4.txt --output counts
...
real	0m10.994s
user	0m10.404s
sys	0m0.472s
```

Where `kinglear_x4.txt` is `kinglear.txt` repeated 4 times.
Since there are many commits here, perhaps just a few can be reviewed at a time and then it will be digestible? I strongly agree with @akedin that this needs an overhaul to be maintainable.
